analyzed: @244a # // rgya gar skad du //
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pra yo ga mu kha /
analyzed: pra yo ga mu kha /
translated: Prayogamukha

original: britti / bod skad du //
analyzed: britti / bod skad du //
translated: In Tibetan:

original: rab tu sbyor ba'i sgo'i 'grel pa //
analyzed: rab tu sbyor ba'i sgo'i 'grel pa //
translated: The commentary on the door of application

original: 'jig rten mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Lord of the World

original: sgra'i rab tu sbyor pa ji snyed pa bzhin du brjod pa shes par 'dod pa des dang por sgra'i gnas byed pa po shes par bya'o //
analyzed: sgra'i rab tu sbyor pa ji snyed pa bzhin du brjod pa shes par 'dod pa des dang por sgra'i gnas byed pa po shes par bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to understand the expression according to the extent of the application of sounds should first understand the agent of the basis of sound.

original: de la byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: de la byed pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa drug ste /
translated: There, what is called the agent is of six kinds:

original: byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / yang dag par sbyin pa dang / gang las 'ongs pa dang / gnas gzhi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa po dang / las dang / byed pa dang / yang dag par sbyin pa dang / gang las 'ongs pa dang / gnas gzhi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The agent, the object, the action, the proper giving, from where it comes, and the basis.

original: yang de dag kyang dbye na nyid shu rtsa gsum du 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang de dag kyang dbye na nyid shu rtsa gsum du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, when those are divided, they become thirty-two.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: byed pa po ni rnam pa lnga /
analyzed: byed pa po ni rnam pa lnga /
translated: The agent is of five kinds.

original: las ni rnam pa bdun //
analyzed: las ni rnam pa bdun //
translated: The object is of seven kinds.

original: byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis /
analyzed: byed pa ni rnam pa gnyis /
translated: The action is of two kinds.

original: yang dag par sbyin pa ni rnam pa gsum /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyin pa ni rnam pa gsum /
translated: The proper giving is of three kinds.

original: gang las 'ongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis /
analyzed: gang las 'ongs pa ni rnam pa gnyis /
translated: From where it comes is of two kinds.

original: gnas gzhi ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhi ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The basis is of four kinds.

original: byed pa po rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa po rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds of agents?

original: rang dbang gi byed pa po dang / rgyu'i byed pa po dang / las kyi byed pa bo dang / ma brjod pa'i byed pa po dang / brjod pa'i byed pa po'o //🔽de la rang dbang gi byed pa po ni ji ltar bsod nams la byed pa ni dad pa dang / byams pa la byed pa ni dge ba'i sems dang / rig pa la byed pa ni blo dang / dpal la byed pa ni brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: rang dbang gi byed pa po dang / rgyu'i byed pa po dang / las kyi byed pa bo dang / ma brjod pa'i byed pa po dang / brjod pa'i byed pa po'o // de la rang dbang gi byed pa po ni ji ltar bsod nams la byed pa ni dad pa dang / byams pa la byed pa ni dge ba'i sems dang / rig pa la byed pa ni blo dang / dpal la byed pa ni brtson 'grus dang /
translated: The independent agent, the causal agent, the agent of action, the unexpressed agent, and the expressed agent.

original: yon tan la thob par byed pa ni le lo med pa ste /
analyzed: yon tan la thob par byed pa ni le lo med pa ste /
translated: Among them, the independent agent is like this: faith is the agent of merit, a virtuous mind is the agent of love, intelligence is the agent of knowledge, diligence is the agent of glory, and non-laziness is the agent of acquiring good qualities.

original: de rnams ni rang dbang gi byed pa po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams ni rang dbang gi byed pa po zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called independent agents.

original: rgyu'i byed pa po ni ji ltar bde ba la rnyed pa ni bsnyen bskur rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu'i byed pa po ni ji ltar bde ba la rnyed pa ni bsnyen bskur rnams so //
translated: The causal agent is like this: wealth is the cause of happiness,

original: brten pa de rnams la brten bas sku la pa ni phan pa rten pa'i brten pa de'i skul la pa ni rgyu'i byed pa po dag go //
analyzed: brten pa de rnams la brten bas sku la pa ni phan pa rten pa'i brten pa de'i skul la pa ni rgyu'i byed pa po dag go //
translated: and the body is the cause of support. These are causal agents.

original: las kyi byed pa po ni ji ltar bdag nyid kyis skye bo gsod pa'i skyon mthong na bdag nyid yongs su sdug bsngal bar byed pa dge ba'i blo dang / bdag nyid kyis skye bo phal pa la zhen pa gcod pa dag ste /
analyzed: las kyi byed pa po ni ji ltar bdag nyid kyis skye bo gsod pa'i skyon mthong na bdag nyid yongs su sdug bsngal bar byed pa dge ba'i blo dang / bdag nyid kyis skye bo phal pa la zhen pa gcod pa dag ste /
translated: The agent of action is like the agent of action who, seeing the fault of killing beings, makes himself suffer, and who, cutting off attachment to ordinary beings, makes himself happy.

original: las lta bu'i las kyi byed pa po 'dra ba zhes bya bas /🔽las kyi bsdu bar 'gyur bar bstan pa las dngos su las dag rtag tu bdag gi tshig @244b can gyi skad kyi dbyings su 'gyur ro //🔽ma brjod pa'i byed pa po ni ji ltar dge ba rnams kyis gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //🔽brjod pa'i byed pa po ni ji ltar gzhan gyi don byed pa ni dge ba'o //🔽las rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /🔽rang nyid 'dod pa'i las dang / rang mi 'dod pa'i las dang / rang 'dod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: las lta bu'i las kyi byed pa po 'dra ba zhes bya bas /🔽las kyi bsdu bar 'gyur bar bstan pa las dngos su las dag rtag tu bdag gi tshig @244b can gyi skad kyi dbyings su 'gyur ro //🔽ma brjod pa'i byed pa po ni ji ltar dge ba rnams kyis gzhan gyi don byed pa'o //🔽brjod pa'i byed pa po ni ji ltar gzhan gyi don byed pa ni dge ba'o //🔽las rnam pa bdun gang zhe na /🔽rang nyid 'dod pa'i las dang / rang mi 'dod pa'i las dang / rang 'dod pa yang ma yin /
translated: The agent of action is

original: mi 'dod pa yang ma yin pa'i las dang / ma smras pa'i las dang / byed pa'i las dang / brjod pa'i las dang / ma brjod pa'i las rnams so //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa yang ma yin pa'i las dang / ma smras pa'i las dang / byed pa'i las dang / brjod pa'i las dang / ma brjod pa'i las rnams so //
translated: There are four kinds of action: action that is desired, action that is not desired, action that is neither desired nor not desired, and action that is neither done nor not done.

original: rang nyid 'dod pa'i las ni ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos shes par dka' ba la yang dad pas sems rnam par grol bar byed pa ni rang 'dod pa'i las zhes bya'o //🔽rang mi 'dod pa'i las ni ji ltar bud med khros pas dug la za ba dang / skyes bu mi shes pas lam tshor ma can la rkang pa 'jog pa dang / mi shes pas sprul la bzung ba lta bu ni ci zhig 'dod pas bdag nyid gsod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: rang nyid 'dod pa'i las ni ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi chos shes par dka' ba la yang dad pas sems rnam par grol bar byed pa ni rang 'dod pa'i las zhes bya'o // rang mi 'dod pa'i las ni ji ltar bud med khros pas dug la za ba dang / skyes bu mi shes pas lam tshor ma can la rkang pa 'jog pa dang / mi shes pas sprul la bzung ba lta bu ni ci zhig 'dod pas bdag nyid gsod pa lta bu ste /
translated: Action that is desired is like the action of faith in the knowledge of the Buddha's teaching, which liberates the mind.🔽Action that is not desired is like the action of a woman in anger who eats poison, or the action of a man who, not knowing the way, puts his foot down on a painful spot, or the action of one who, not knowing, grasps a snake.

original: rang nyid mi 'dod pa'i las zhes bya'o //🔽rang 'dod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: rang nyid mi 'dod pa'i las zhes bya'o //🔽rang 'dod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Action that is neither desired nor not desired is like the action of one who, out of desire, kills himself.🔽Action that is neither done nor not done is like the action of one who is neither a speaker nor a non-speaker.

original: mi 'dod pa yang ma yin pa'i las ni ji ltar byis pa mi shes pas 'o thug rdul can 'thung ba lta bu ni rang nyid 'dod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa yang ma yin pa'i las ni ji ltar byis pa mi shes pas 'o thug rdul can 'thung ba lta bu ni rang nyid 'dod pa yang ma yin /
translated: Karma that is neither desired nor not desired is like the karma of a fool who drinks dusty gruel.

original: mi 'dod pa yang ma yin pa'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa yang ma yin pa'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: Karma that is neither desired nor not desired is like the karma of a fool who drinks dusty gruel.

original: ma smras pa'i las ni ji ltar ba las 'o ma 'jo ba ni ba lang rdzi dang / mchod sbyin la la sreg pa lhas byin dang / ba lang la skyong du 'gro ba ba lang rdzi dang / mkhan po la bstan bcos zhu ba ni bram ze'i khye'u dang /
analyzed: ma smras pa'i las ni ji ltar ba las 'o ma 'jo ba ni ba lang rdzi dang / mchod sbyin la la sreg pa lhas byin dang / ba lang la skyong du 'gro ba ba lang rdzi dang / mkhan po la bstan bcos zhu ba ni bram ze'i khye'u dang /
translated: Karma that is not spoken is like a cowherd who milks a cow, Devadatta who makes a burnt offering, a cowherd who goes to tend the cattle, a young brahmin who requests a treatise from his preceptor,

original: phyug po la gser slong ba bram ze dang / shing rnams la 'bras bu 'thog pa khye'u dang / slob ma la chos smra ba slob dpon dang / bu la bstan bcos rjes su ston pa mkhan po lta bu ni ma smras pa'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyug po la gser slong ba bram ze dang / shing rnams la 'bras bu 'thog pa khye'u dang / slob ma la chos smra ba slob dpon dang / bu la bstan bcos rjes su ston pa mkhan po lta bu ni ma smras pa'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: a brahmin who begs for gold from a rich man, a boy who picks fruit from trees, a master who teaches the Dharma to his disciple, and a preceptor who instructs his student in the treatises.

original: byed pa'i las ni ji ltar slob ma la drung du 'ong bar byed pa ni slob dpon zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i las ni ji ltar slob ma la drung du 'ong bar byed pa ni slob dpon zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: Karma that is done is like a master who causes a disciple to come into his presence.

original: 'gro ba dang slob pa dang so sor gnas ba rnams kyi sgra'i don las rnams byed pa'i rkyen can zhes bya ba ni las kyi ming ngo //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang slob pa dang so sor gnas ba rnams kyi sgra'i don las rnams byed pa'i rkyen can zhes bya ba ni las kyi ming ngo //
translated: The verbal action is the condition of the activity of the meaning of the words of those who are going, learning, and abiding individually.

original: brjod pa'i las ni ji ltar lhas byin gyi bya ba rtsva'i stan lta bu'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i las ni ji ltar lhas byin gyi bya ba rtsva'i stan lta bu'o //
translated: The verbal action is like Devadatta’s action of sitting on a straw mat.

original: ma brjod pa'i las ni ji ltar stan las byed pa ni lhas byin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma brjod pa'i las ni ji ltar stan las byed pa ni lhas byin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The non-verbal action is like Devadatta’s action of sitting on a mat.

original: byed pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: byed pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two kinds of action?

original: phyi rol gyi byed pa dang / nang gi byed pa @245a * //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi byed pa dang / nang gi byed pa @245a * //
translated: External action and internal action.

original: pa'o // phyi rol gyi byed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: pa'o // phyi rol gyi byed pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is external action?

original: gang lus kyi yan lag las phyi rol du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang lus kyi yan lag las phyi rol du gyur pa ste /
translated: It is that which is external to the limbs of the body.

original: ji ltar zhing la zor bas rnga ba ni mi lta bu dang / shing la sta res gcod pa ni lhas byin lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhing la zor bas rnga ba ni mi lta bu dang / shing la sta res gcod pa ni lhas byin lta bu'o //
translated: It is like a plow plowing a field, or an axe cutting down a tree.

original: nang gi ni lus kyi yan lag la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: nang gi ni lus kyi yan lag la gnas pa ste /
translated: Internal action is that which is based on the limbs of the body.

original: dper na lhas byin yid kyis pa ta la'i grong khyer du 'gro ba dang / mig gis gzugs la 'dzin pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na lhas byin yid kyis pa ta la'i grong khyer du 'gro ba dang / mig gis gzugs la 'dzin pa lta bu ste /
translated: For example, Devadatta goes to the city of Patali with his mind, and he sees forms with his eyes.

original: byed pa zhes pa ni shin tu sgrub par byed ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: byed pa zhes pa ni shin tu sgrub par byed ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The term “agent” is a designation for one who is a very powerful actor.

original: gsum pa byed pa po dang byed pa'i gsum pa dag go //
analyzed: gsum pa byed pa po dang byed pa'i gsum pa dag go //
translated: The third is the three types of agent and action.

original: yang dag par sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par sbyin pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three types of correct giving?

original: slong ba dang / rjes su byed pa dang / slong ba med pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: slong ba dang / rjes su byed pa dang / slong ba med pa rnams la'o //
translated: They are to beggars, to those who follow, and to those who do not beg.

original: slong ba la ni ji ltar bram ze la ba lang sbyin pa ni chos dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: slong ba la ni ji ltar bram ze la ba lang sbyin pa ni chos dang ldan pa'o //
translated: To beggars is like a brahmin giving a cow, which is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: bram ze slong ba rnyed ba de'i phyir slong ba la zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bram ze slong ba rnyed ba de'i phyir slong ba la zhes brjod do //
translated: Because the brahmin obtains the gift by begging, it is called “to beggars.”

original: rjes su byed pa ni ji ltar 'gron po'i phyir shing sbyin pa'i tshul te /
analyzed: rjes su byed pa ni ji ltar 'gron po'i phyir shing sbyin pa'i tshul te /
translated: To those who follow is like the way of giving a tree for guests.

original: de dag gi phyir ma bslangs par 'gron gyis shing gi rtsa ba khyer ba ni sems kyis rjes su byed pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir ma bslangs par 'gron gyis shing gi rtsa ba khyer ba ni sems kyis rjes su byed pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because of them, even though not asked, the guest takes the root of the tree, which is called “following the mind.”

original: slong ba med pa ni ji ltar mchod rten la me tog 'bul ba'i skyes bu lta bu'o //
analyzed: slong ba med pa ni ji ltar mchod rten la me tog 'bul ba'i skyes bu lta bu'o //
translated: The person who gives without begging is like the person who offers flowers to a stupa.

original: gang mngon par slong ba la yang dag par sbyin pa'i las ni yang dag par sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: gang mngon par slong ba la yang dag par sbyin pa'i las ni yang dag par sbyin pa ste /
translated: The action of giving to those who beg is giving correctly.

original: bzhi pa yang dag par sbyin ba ni yang dag par sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa yang dag par sbyin ba ni yang dag par sbyin pa'o //
translated: The fourth line shows giving correctly.

original: gang las 'ongs pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang las 'ongs pa rnam pa gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two kinds of coming?

original: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dag las so //
analyzed: g-yo ba dang mi g-yo ba dag las so //
translated: From the moving and from the unmoving.

original: g-yo ba las ni ji ltar rta brgyugs pa las ltung ba ni rta ba'o //
analyzed: g-yo ba las ni ji ltar rta brgyugs pa las ltung ba ni rta ba'o //
translated: From the moving is like a horse-rider falling from a horse,

original: glang po brgyugs pa las ltung ba ni lcags kyu 'dzin pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: glang po brgyugs pa las ltung ba ni lcags kyu 'dzin pa zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: or like a hook-holder falling from an elephant.🔽From the unmoving is like one coming from a town, like Devadatta,🔽or like a great sage descending from a mountain,

original: mi g-yo ba las ni ji ltar grong las 'ongs pa ni lhas byin dang / ri las babs pa ni drang srong chen po rnams dang ; mtho ris las babs pa ni lha zhes pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba las ni ji ltar grong las 'ongs pa ni lhas byin dang / ri las babs pa ni drang srong chen po rnams dang ; mtho ris las babs pa ni lha zhes pa lta bu ste /
translated: or like a god descending from heaven.

original: bstan pa las 'ongs pa ni lam gang las 'ongs pa ste /
analyzed: bstan pa las 'ongs pa ni lam gang las 'ongs pa ste /
translated: Coming from the teaching is the path from which one comes.

original: gang las 'ongs pa ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gang las 'ongs pa ni lnga pa'o //
translated: The fifth line shows coming from the path.

original: gnas gzhi rnam pa gzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gzhi rnam pa gzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis of the state?

original: khyab pa'i gnas gzhi dang / nye bar brtan pa'i dang / 'dug gnas kyi dang / nye ba'i gnas gzhi'o //
analyzed: khyab pa'i gnas gzhi dang / nye bar brtan pa'i dang / 'dug gnas kyi dang / nye ba'i gnas gzhi'o //
translated: The basis of the state is of four kinds: the basis of pervasion, the basis of support, the basis of dwelling, and the basis of proximity.

original: khyab pa'i ni ji ltar til mar ni til rnams la khyab pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: khyab pa'i ni ji ltar til mar ni til rnams la khyab pa lta bu'o //
translated: The basis of pervasion is like the pervasion of sesame oil in sesame seeds.

original: nye bar brten pa'i ni ji ltar stan la brten pa ni skyes bu dang / shing rta la brten pa ni bram ze dang / rten la brten pa ni drang @245b srong zhes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nye bar brten pa'i ni ji ltar stan la brten pa ni skyes bu dang / shing rta la brten pa ni bram ze dang / rten la brten pa ni drang @245b srong zhes pa lta bu'o //
translated: The basis of support is like a person sitting on a seat, a brahmin sitting on a chariot, or a sage sitting on a support.

original: 'dug gnas kyi gnas gzhi ni ji ltar nags la gnas pa ni seng ge lta bu dang / gnas la gnas pa ni thub pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dug gnas kyi gnas gzhi ni ji ltar nags la gnas pa ni seng ge lta bu dang / gnas la gnas pa ni thub pa lta bu'o //
translated: The basis of dwelling is like a lion dwelling in the forest, or a sage dwelling in a dwelling.

original: nye ba'i gnas gzhi ni ji ltar chu klung la gnas pa ni ba lang lta bu ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i gnas gzhi ni ji ltar chu klung la gnas pa ni ba lang lta bu ste /
translated: The basis of proximity is like cows dwelling near a river.

original: gnas kyi gzhi byed pa ni gnas gzhi ste /
analyzed: gnas kyi gzhi byed pa ni gnas gzhi ste /
translated: The basis of the state is that which serves as the basis of the state.

original: bdun pa gnas gzhi ni gnas gzhi'o //
analyzed: bdun pa gnas gzhi ni gnas gzhi'o //
translated: The seventh case is the basis of the state.

original: gang 'di byed pa zhes smos pas byed pa por 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang 'di byed pa zhes smos pas byed pa por 'gyur te /
translated: By mentioning this as the agent, it becomes the agent.

original: 'di ltar bya ba byed pa ni byed pa po zhes byed par 'gyur bas byed pa po smos ci dgos she na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba byed pa ni byed pa po zhes byed par 'gyur bas byed pa po smos ci dgos she na /
translated: If the agent is the one who performs the action, then why mention the agent?

original: gzhan las dang byed pa dang / yang dag par sbyin pa dang / gang las 'ongs pa dang / gnas gzhi zhes bya ba rnams kyi byed pa po rnams ni ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan las dang byed pa dang / yang dag par sbyin pa dang / gang las 'ongs pa dang / gnas gzhi zhes bya ba rnams kyi byed pa po rnams ni ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could the agent be established in the case of other actions, such as giving, from which it comes, and the basis of the action?

original: de rnams la yang thams cad la byed pa po ni brjod do //
analyzed: de rnams la yang thams cad la byed pa po ni brjod do //
translated: The agent is mentioned in all of these.

original: gang las she na /🔽rang dbang brjod par 'dod pa yis //
analyzed: gang las she na / rang dbang brjod par 'dod pa yis //
translated: From what?🔽From the one who is said to be independent.

original: zhes pa so so'i byed pa po gang rang dbang gi brjod par 'dod pas byed pa po de thams cad brjod pa yang 'grub bo //
analyzed: zhes pa so so'i byed pa po gang rang dbang gi brjod par 'dod pas byed pa po de thams cad brjod pa yang 'grub bo //
translated: The agent is mentioned in all of these cases, because the agent is the one who is said to be independent.

original: de la brjod pa'i byed pa po ni dang po nyid du bya ste /
analyzed: de la brjod pa'i byed pa po ni dang po nyid du bya ste /
translated: The agent who is mentioned is the first.

original: ji ltar lhas byin 'bras chan 'tshed do zhes pa dang / lhas byin rtsva yis stan byed ces pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lhas byin 'bras chan 'tshed do zhes pa dang / lhas byin rtsva yis stan byed ces pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “Devadatta cooks rice” and “Devadatta makes a mat from straw.”

original: ma brjod pa'i byed pa po na /
analyzed: ma brjod pa'i byed pa po na /
translated: The agent who is not mentioned is the second.

original: ma brjod pa'i byed pa po rnam par dbye ba gnyis su 'gyur te /🔽gsum pa ni ji ltar lhas byin gyis 'bras chan 'tshod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ma brjod pa'i byed pa po rnam par dbye ba gnyis su 'gyur te / gsum pa ni ji ltar lhas byin gyis 'bras chan 'tshod pa lta bu ste /
translated: The unexpressed agent is twofold.🔽The third is like Devadatta cooking rice.

original: gsum pa zhes pa ni byed pa po dang byed pa dag ni gsum po //
analyzed: gsum pa zhes pa ni byed pa po dang byed pa dag ni gsum po //
translated: The third is like Devadatta cooking rice.

original: drug pa ni ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol gyis 'jigs pas chos spyod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: drug pa ni ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol gyis 'jigs pas chos spyod pa lta bu ste /
translated: The sixth is like observing Dharma out of fear of the next world.

original: bya ba byed pa rnams ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byed pa rnams ni drug pa'o //

translated: the principal meaning of the first word, the principal meaning of the last word, and the principal meaning of another word.

analyzed: tshig snga ma'i don gtso bo ni ji ltar nye ba bum pa zhes pa'o //
translated: The principal meaning of the first word is like the expression “near pot.”

analyzed: tshig phyi ma'i don gtso bo ni ji ltar lo ma la so so ni lo ma so so zhes pa dang / sha la so so ni sha so so zhes pa'o //
translated: The primary meaning of the last word is that each leaf is a separate leaf, and each piece of meat is a separate piece of meat.

original: tshig gzhan gyi don gtso bo ni ji ltar gang la smyo byed kyi chu klung yod pa de ni smyo byed kyi chu klung ste yul gyi ming ngo //
analyzed: tshig gzhan gyi don gtso bo ni ji ltar gang la smyo byed kyi chu klung yod pa de ni smyo byed kyi chu klung ste yul gyi ming ngo //
translated: The primary meaning of the other word is that a place where there is a river of madness is called a river of madness, and that is the name of the country.

original: tshig gzhan gyi don nyid zad par mi 'gyur ba'i tshig sdud pa'i ming zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gzhan gyi don nyid zad par mi 'gyur ba'i tshig sdud pa'i ming zhes bya'o //
translated: The very meaning of the other word is called the name of the collection of words that do not end.

original: zad par mi 'gyur ba mo'i rtags la pho'i rtags su smras pa ni mo'i rtags la gang ba dang / 'dod pa la sogs pa'i gtso bos snga ma'i tshig pho lta bur gyur ba'o //

translated: The word that does not end is said to be the male sign in the female sign, and it is the fullness in the female sign, and the former word that is like a male due to being the chief of desire and so forth.

original: zad par mi 'gyur ba ni ma ning gi rtags zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zad par mi 'gyur ba ni ma ning gi rtags zhes bya ste /
translated: That which does not end is called the neuter sign.

original: thung ngu nyid ni ma ning la sgra'i rang bzhin thung du nyid dang / zad par mi 'gyur pa ni zad par mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: thung ngu nyid ni ma ning la sgra'i rang bzhin thung du nyid dang / zad par mi 'gyur pa ni zad par mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Shortness is the nature of sound in the neuter, and that which does not end is that which does not end.

original: sub dbyi bas zad par mi 'gyur ba'o //
